intro: Psychotria boloboensis var. balimensis, commonly known as the Balimense Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. This plant is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
